intro: Ahernia glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular ahernia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow or orange. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, which contribute to its distinctive appearance. Ahernia glandulosa is often found in dry, rocky habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and horticultural contexts.
